text: Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email What the Pistons' new practice facility means for Detroit Pistons Coach Stan Van Gundy said the facility will be the best in the NBA. A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 7 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs What the Pistons' new practice facility means for Detroit John Gallagher , Detroit Free Press Published 5:29 p.m. ET Feb. 24, 2017 | Updated 3 hours ago Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Detroit Pistons head coach Stan Van Gundy, left, poses with Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer at Henry Ford Health System Robert Riney, Detroit City Council member Mary Sheffield, CEO of Henry Ford Health Systems Wright L. Lassiter lll, Detroit Mayor Mike Duggan, Pistons center Andre Drummond, and PS&E Vice Chairman Arn Tellem pose as the Pistons and Henry Ford Health System announce a state-of-the art practice facility Feb. 24, 2017. Mandi Wright, DFP Fullscreen Detroit Pistons Hall of Famer and Mayor of Detroit Dave Bing was present as the Pistons and Henry Ford Health System announce a state-of-the art training, rehabilitation and sports medicine complex Friday, Feb. 24, 2017 that will be located in the New Center area of Detroit. Mandi Wright, DFP Fullscreen Pistons president of basketball operations and head coach Stan Van Gundy is applauded as the Detroit Pistons and Henry Ford Health System announce a state-of-the art training, rehabilitation and sports medicine complex Friday, Feb. 24, 2017 that will be located in the New Center area of Detroit. Mandi Wright, DFP Fullscreen Wright L. Lassiter III, president and CEO of Henry Ford Health System, signs a ceremonial basketball as the Detroit Pistons and Henry Ford Health System announce a state-of-the art training, rehabilitation and sports medicine complex Friday, Feb. 24, 2017 that will be located in the New Center area of Detroit. Mandi Wright, DFP A ceremonial basketball was signed as the Detroit Pistons and Henry Ford Health System announced a state-of-the art training, rehabilitation and sports medicine complex Friday, Feb. 24, 2017 that will be located in the New Center area of Detroit. Mandi Wright, DFP Fullscreen Detroit City Council member Mary Sheffield, left, and Detroit Mayor Mike Duggan share a laugh as the Detroit Pistons and Henry Ford Health System announce a state-of-the art training, rehabilitation and sports medicine complex Friday, Feb. 24, 2017 that will be located in the New Center area of Detroit. Mandi Wright, DFP Rendering of Detroit Pistons practice facility. Detroit Pistons Rendering of Detroit Pistons practice facility Detroit Pistons Rendering of Detroit Pistons practice facility. Detroit Pistons Rendering of the Detroit Pistons training, rehab and sports medicine facility in Detroit's New Center district. The Pistons are partnering with Henry Ford Health System and it will be called the Henry Ford-Detroit Pistons Performance Center. Detroit Pistons Like this topic?
